blog.name: ofbeornandbjorn
blog.title: månen vil blø
blog.description: Sara, 22 | marvel, wrestling, vikings, tolkien, too many fandoms, berserkr, feminist, aesthetic.

tags: They are all my life from my childhood to now and I love them so much
I only have to say thank you
body:
things the avengers taught me:

Clint: Clint taught me to be true to myself, to not change to please the others, people can love you or not, they can think you are making the worst mistakes of your life, but you have to stay true to yourself and stand for what you think it’s worth and right and if need fight the world. That family it’s not a weakness it’s a safe place.

Natasha: she taught me to shape myself to be what I need to be for myself, to be the best for myself, because at the end of the day I am the only one I can trust and only I have my own back all the time. She taught me what sacrifice means. I have to be strong for myself and for how much be indipendent and strong is a value, have soft spots and have fear it’s part of the process. She taught me to have faith and that family it’s not DNA.

Tony: “The only way in it’s through” I don’t really know why, but every time I read this quote I think about Tony and about how much he had to go through. He taught me that we can be so fucked up, to feel like everything we do it’s wrong and not because we’re making a mistake but because think we are broken, demaged or cursed, or to think that everyone will be just fine without us around, that we are only a waste of time, and STILL wake up every sigle day and fight our demons, and punch them so hard in the face, kick their asses so bad that they’ll think twice before came back to bother us again. He taught me how to be true to my emotions, to not fake it, not make it worse, to speak my mind and my heart. That be good at something, to enjoy or be passionate about something it’s just the best feeling in life. If life gives you pain and lemons, make a fricking flying robot made of lemons and go kick the world in the butt.

Thor: Thor taught me to be kind and compassionate, that everyone have a story to tell and a war that they’re fighting, so be sure to be kind. He taught me that love it’s something bigger than the galaxies, even if sometimes it’s hard to understand or painful, even if sometimes we fell for the wrong person or for the idea of have them by our side, just for not be alone. But he taught me the difference between be alone and feel lonely. To love someone unconditionally, in the bad and good times, and that the love and the affection between siblings even if can be harsh or distant it’s still hide in the deep and it only need a little bit more of time to grow up.

Steve: Steve taught me to be loyal, to be honest and to stand still in frame, to plant my feet on the ground like a tree and stand up for what it’s right, to protect and defend what it’s important to me and to have no afraid to get hurt, because sometimes we just refuse to do something only for the fear to get hurt or to mess up everything, the blood or the mess can be wiped away. We can start again, life don’t start and finish with us, life goes on and on and death takes and takes without asking you the permission, so we have to be sharp and do what we need and want to do, whatever it takes.

Bruce: Bruce taught me that be shy or insicure it’s not a weakness, sometimes it’s just a shield, an invisible protective shield, and to be patient, to value my feelings and not rush into situations or relationships only because they makes me feel good, to have doubts, to over-think if need, to take my time to value every possibilities, the pro and cons, to take my time and find my own rhythm, because be alert it’s so underrated. He taught me that people cares so much about how you look, how you act, your attitude and how you speak your mind, and that we just have to live your life like if only the things that make you feel good are the only things that really matters.

summary: okay but i really wanna see some behind the scenes material for that ass of america scene cause like,,, were the other guys...
body: okay but i really wanna see some behind the scenes material for that ass of america scene cause like,,, were the other guys there when they filmed it? what was chris’ reaction to reading that scene in the first place? how were they able to do the scene so casually without fkn bursting out laughing? and if they didn’t can we please have the gag reel?? WHO THOUGHT OF THIS??? in conclusion i want some context to one of the best scenes in mcu

summary: Confession: I don’t like Captain Marvel. I feel like her character falls into the trap of “woman has to be stronger and cockier...
body:
Confession: I don’t like Captain Marvel. I feel like her character falls into the trap of “woman has to be stronger and cockier than all the men in order to be validated/considered on the same level as them”. There are a million of those kind of female characters in movies, especially action movies. She’s not new or groundbreaking. I’d so much rather a flawed, underdog female character that has worth despite not being the strongest physically and not being cocky and confident. 

I also don’t like how everyone expects us to just accept her as the strongest avenger. That’s a position you have to earn, you aren’t just given. 

Shuri, for example. Not a great fighter. But she’s brave and a genius and she thinks her way out of problems. No superpowers.

Natasha Romanoff. She’s confident and strong but she’s also not afraid to admit her limits. She gets hurts and sometimes hesitates to do the right thing. No superpowers. And yet, since Iron Man 2, it’s been canon within the fandom that she could take down any of the other Avengers (and the they know it)

Pepper Potts. She doesn’t fight. She just is the CEO of the biggest company in the world and takes care of the hot mess than is Tony Anthony Stark. She’s mentally strong and confident, but she’s not going to throw it in people’s faces that she is

summary: I've been in Tumblr for almost five years and only until yesterday I made my first post and the attention it has had is amazing,...
body: I’ve been in Tumblr for almost five years and only until yesterday I made my first post and the attention it has had is amazing, 108! For me that’s a lot because I never post stuff and nobody follows me, the fact thaf people has given me support for the bad feelings I have makes me feeel special and not alone. Aday of being active here and I can say people here is the most caring of all social apps and I even understand more why tumblr really is a family.

blog.name: awkwardclumsy
blog.title: Awkward
blog.description: Loving Benny Weir, Peter Parker, Number Five, and Cyrus Goodman is kinda my Brand™

body:
Unpopular Opinion

Now that Cassie Lang is 15, she should be Scott’s sidekick. Not only did they both really seem to want that, but it would be a nice break from the “my significant other is my sidekick!” trope. A cute father/daughter bug themed team is all I want, Marvel.

reblog.comment:
Unpopular Opinion

Now that Cassie Lang is 15, she should be Scott’s sidekick. Not only did they both really seem to want that, but it would be a nice break from the “my significant other is my sidekick!” trope. A cute father/daughter bug themed team is all I want, Marvel.
